
::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer = "MPSZ-2019") %>% st_transform(crs = 3414)
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata <- read_csv("data/aspatial/respopagesextod2011to2020.csv")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2020 <- popdata %>%
  filter(Time == 2020) %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup()%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=AG, 
              values_from=POP) %>%
  mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])
         +rowSums(.[12])) %>%
mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:11])+
rowSums(.[13:15]))%>%
mutate(`AGED`=rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
mutate(`TOTAL`=rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%  
mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`)
/`ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
  select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`, 
       `ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`, 
       `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2020 <- popdata2020 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ), 
          .funs = list(toupper)) %>%
  filter(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` > 0)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz_pop2020 <- left_join(mpsz, popdata2020,
                          by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
write_rds(mpsz_pop2020, "data/rds/mpszpop2020.rds")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
qtm(mpsz_pop2020, 
    fill = "DEPENDENCY")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "Dependency ratio") +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of Dependency Ratio by planning subzone",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar() +
  tm_grid(alpha =0.2) +
  tm_credits("Source: Planning Sub-zone boundary from Urban Redevelopment Authorithy (URA)\n and Population data from Department of Statistics DOS", 
             position = c("left", "bottom"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_polygons()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_polygons("DEPENDENCY")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY") +
  tm_borders(lwd = 0.1,  alpha = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


'Natural Breaks' (or 'Jenks') minimizes within-class variance and maximizes between-class variance.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          n = 5,
          style = "jenks") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


'Equal Interval' divides the data into equal size classes.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          n = 5,
          style = "equal") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


'Pretty Breaks' creates aesthetically pleasing breaks based on the range of the data.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_polygons("DEPENDENCY", style = 'pretty', title = 'Pretty Breaks')
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


'Quantile' ensures an equal number of observations in each class.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_polygons("DEPENDENCY", style = 'quantile', title = 'Quantile')
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


'Standard Deviation' creates classes based on the standard deviation from the mean.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_polygons("DEPENDENCY", style = 'sd', title = 'Standard Deviation')
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Data distribution

How the data values are spread across the map. More classes can capture more variability and nuances in the data, but also make the map more complex and harder to interpret. Fewer classes can simplify the map and highlight the general patterns, but also lose some details and outliers.

### Class intervals

How the data values are grouped into classes. Different classification methods can create different class intervals, which can affect the visual representation and interpretation of the map. For example, equal interval divides the data range into equal intervals, quantile divides the data into equal numbers of data points, and natural breaks finds natural groupings based on data distribution

### Visualization

How the map colors and symbols convey the data values. The choice of color scheme, symbol size, and transparency can influence the readability and aesthetics of the map. For example, sequential colors can show the gradual change of data values, while diverging colors can show the contrast between high and low values. Larger symbols and higher transparency can emphasize the data values, while smaller symbols and lower transparency can reduce the visual clutter.


::: {.cell}

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(mpsz_pop2020$DEPENDENCY)
```

```

 0.1111  0.7137  0.7862  0.8579  0.8767 19.0000      98 
```

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          breaks = c(0, 0.60, 0.70, 0.80, 0.90, 1.00)) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "jenks", 
          palette = "Blues", 
          legend.hist = TRUE, 
          legend.is.portrait = TRUE,
          legend.hist.z = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of Dependency Ratio by planning subzone \n(Jenks classification)",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,
            legend.outside = FALSE,
            legend.position = c("right", "bottom"),
            frame = FALSE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

```{.r .cell-code}

  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",

          palette = "-Greens") +

```

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "No. of persons") +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of Dependency Ratio \nby planning subzone",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 1.2,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,

  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +

  tm_credits("Source: Planning Sub-zone boundary from Urban Redevelopment Authorithy (URA)\n and Population data from Department of Statistics DOS",
```

:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}

  tm_fill(c("YOUNG", "AGED"),
          style = "equal", 
          palette = "Blues") +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c("right", "bottom")) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tmap_style("white")
```

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons(c("DEPENDENCY","AGED"),
          style = c("equal", "quantile"), 
          palette = list("Blues","Greens")) +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c("right", "bottom"))
```

![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-32-1.png){width=672}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020) +
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY",
          style = "quantile",
          palette = "Blues",
          thres.poly = 0) + 
  tm_facets(by="REGION_N", 
            free.coords=TRUE, 
            drop.shapes=TRUE) +
  tm_layout(legend.show = FALSE,
            title.position = c("center", "center"), 
            title.size = 20) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-33-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
youngmap <- tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons("YOUNG", 
              style = "quantile", 
              palette = "Blues")

agedmap <- tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020)+ 
  tm_polygons("AGED", 
              style = "quantile", 
              palette = "Blues")

tmap_arrange(youngmap, agedmap, asp=1, ncol=2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex1b_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-34-1.png){width=672}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(mpsz_pop2020[mpsz_pop2020$REGION_N=="CENTRAL REGION", ])+
  tm_fill("DEPENDENCY", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues", 
          legend.hist = TRUE, 
          legend.is.portrait = TRUE,
          legend.hist.z = 0.1) +
  tm_layout(legend.outside = TRUE,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 5.0,
            legend.position = c("right", "bottom"),
            frame = FALSE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```
